stories.text:
1. Open RegEdit from the Start menu and create the following Key

Computer\HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SOFTWARE\Policies\Google\Chrome*URLBlocklist*

(You can also use HKEY_CURRENT_USER)

2. For each URL you want to block create a new String value, named by a number.

E.g

Name: 1

Value: https://*.ycombinator.com

3. Set the command line flag --install-url-blocklist-handlers (right click Chrome's shortcut, go to Properties, then to the Shortcut tab, and append the switch to the end of the Target value)

4. Restart Chrome. All ycombinator.com subdomains will now be blocked.

For more patterns info: https://www.chromium.org/administrators/url-blocklist-filter-format

For more command line switches: https://peter.sh/experiments/chromium-command-line-switches/
stories.title: Tell HN: Block URLs in Chrome on Windows Without an Extension
AppImageLauncher to Integrate AppImages in Your Linux Distro
New app raises money to improve Salesforce productivity

stories.text:
For my next review my boss has asked me to talk about the latest and greatest marketing guff. He is an ad man through and through and really he just wants to see me get excited about the latest marketing gimick and sell him on the idea. When the conversation moves to price we won't have the money for it so I won't have to worry about implementing the idea if its unrealistic.

The more out there the idea the better he will like it, think advertising banners flying behind drones. Last time I talked about facebook chatbots as it was the latest fad at the time but whats new? Whats the latest fad that gets your boss excited?
